page.title: 02Industry in Gourdon
page.content: In the village some people find work at the{jute mill.}It has a night shift and a day shift. There are 3 lorries that bring about 124-140 bales of raw jute each day. The jute costs Â£600-Â£800 a tonne. At the jute mill there are over 80 people working. The mill gets most workers from Gourdon, Bervie and Johnshaven. The jute mill is very dusty, dirty and very noisy so you have to wear things in your ears called pops to protect your ears from being deafened by the noise. All the jute at the mill comes from {Bangladesh.}The jute gets spun into 2 ply and 3 ply. 2 ply is two pieces of jute twisted together and 3 ply is three pieces twisted together. After everything is done to the jute it gets put into boxes and sent to Dundee.
